body.p: Served as both private and eventually Second Lieutenant of the 6th United States Infantry from 1847 until 1853. Enlisted as a private in the 4th Kentucky Infantry, U.S.A. on August 6, 1861. Served as a First Lieutenant and Quartermaster in the 5th Kentucky Cavalry, U.S.A., from October 22, 1861 until February 17, 1862. Served as an Aide de Camp to Jeremiah T. Boyle during the battle of Shiloh and siege of Corinth, Mississippi until May 1862. Major of the 9th Kentucky Cavalry, U.S.A. from August 22, 1862 until March 10, 1863. Commanded Barracks No. 1 in Louisville, Kentucky, from March 10, 1863 until October 16, 1863. Served as a detective in and around Louisville from 1863 to 1864.
